content:
• Wednesday, September 18, 2013
  • TTWO

    Take-Two +4.4% AH following shareholder meeting

    • Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) wrapped up its annual meeting (webcast) a little while ago. The company has issued a PR noting all existing directors were re-elected, including Brett Icahn (Carl Icahn's son). and that some run-of-the-mill shareholder proposals were approved.
    • Shares finished regular trading up 1.2% (nearly in-line with the Nasdaq) after the game developer estimated retail Grand Theft Auto V sales topped $800M in the game's first 24 hours of availability.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TSPT +6%. FIVE +6%. GNK +3%. GERN +3%. BTN +2%.
    • Top losers: EXK -8%. JMI -7%. ARR -6%. WAGE -5%. RYL -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 5 Comments
  • SCS

    Steelcase slides 6.8% AH on off-the-mark Q2 results

    • Shares of Steelcase (NYSE:SCS) fall 6.8% AH after Q2 results miss expectations.
    • The EMEA segment was a sore spot and offset strength in America. "Our global competitiveness continues to be negatively impacted by the cost structures within our EMEA segment, which has generated adjusted operating losses of $18.9 million during the first half of this fiscal year," said CFO David Sylvester.
    • Management guides to Q3 revenue of $755M-$780M (consensus of $757.1M) and EPS of $0.23-$0.27 (consensus of $0.26)
    • PR,Â Conference call at 11 am ET
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • SSNC

    Carlyle to exit 7.47M share stake in SS&C

    • SS&C (NASDAQ:SSNC) tumbles 3.7% AH after Carlyle moves to exit its 7.47M share (9.2%) stake through a public offering. Closing is expected on Sept. 24.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • ROYT

    Pacific Coast Oil Trust in 13.5M-unit offering, -5.8% AH

    • Pacific Coast Oil Trust (NYSE:ROYT) -5.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 13.5M trust units by parent Pacific Coast Energy and other selling unitholders.
    • PCEC plans to use the net proceeds from the sale of its trust units to pay down debt; the trust will not sell any trust units and will not receive any proceeds.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • RTRX

    Retrophin looks to acquire Transcept for $4/share

    • Retrophin (NASDAQ:RTRX) floats a proposal to acquire Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) for $4/share.
    • The move comes after TSPT's board adpoted a poison pill and rejected an offer of $3.50/share last week.
    • Retrophin says the deal "represents an attractive premium to TSPT's trading performance, and ... offers a compelling opportunity for TSPT's stockholders."
    • Retrophin CEO Martin Shkreli goes on to call TSPT's acquisition strategy "risky and controversial." (PR)
    • TSPT +8% AH on top of 8% during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle beats by $0.03, misses on revenues

    • Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ1 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $8.37B (+2% Y/Y) misses by $0.11B.
    • Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • TWGP

    Piling on, Sidoti downgrades Tower Group to Neutral

    • Tower Group (TWGP -28%) ends a dismal day with a downgrade from Sidoti to Neutral from Buy. Shares collapsed earlier after FBR downgraded the the insurer on the belief that a forthcoming reserve charge could be worse than anticipated.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • NUE

    Steel companies gain as BMO starts coverage

    • BMO initiates coverage of steel companies (NYSEARCA:SLX) Nucor (NUE +2.7%), Commercial Metals (CMC +2.3%), U.S. Steel (X +2.6%) and Steel Dynamics (STLD +0.9%).
    • NUE, started at Outperform with a $54 price target, is arguably the best of breed, with the highest margins in the group and best balance sheet; it also has best execution and benefits from growing low-cost DRI production.
    • CMC also is initiated at Outperform; it trades at the lowest valuation in the steel sector based on adjusted EV/EBITDA, dividend yield and free cash flow yield, and is leveraged to non-residential construction expected to improve over the next one or two years.
    • X is started at Market Perform; its balance sheet is by far the most stretched of the group at 5x net debt to EBITDA for FY2013, and there is potential for dilution from an out-of-the-money convertible bond due in 2014.
    • Earlier:Â STLD is started at Market Perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • TGI

    Triumph Group slides on extra 747-8 program costs

    • Boeing supplier Triumph Group (TGI -8.4%) says it will likely book ~$68M in pre-tax additional program costs in FY14 thanks to "reductions to the profitability estimates of the current 747-8 production lot."
    • The costs will be spread out as follows: FQ2, $0.53/share; FQ3, $0.14/share; FQ4, $0.16/share.
    • CEO Jeffry Frisby is "disappointed in [TGI's] recent execution on the 747 program," but notes that the company has "already taken several actions, including the development of a detailed game plan to reduce cost and improve quality and on-time delivery in a sustainable way." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources pushes higher on Global Hunter upgrade

    • Comstock Resources (CRK +1.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Accumulate at Global Hunter, which cites increased confidence that CRK will be able to maintain its Eagle Ford production inventory with bolt-on deals in the shale field and without overpaying.
    • The firm also believes shares are cheap at 3.1xÂ  estimated 2014 EBITDA despite 90% of oil estimated production growth coming from within cash flow (at current prices) forecast for 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • BIOF

    Biofuel Energy surges after court ruling for cleaner fuels in California

    • Strength in Biofuel Energy (BIOF +2.6%) is attributed to a ruling from the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals ruling in favor of a policy that advances the adoption of cleaner fuels in California's marketplace.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners expands Mont Belvieu plant capacity

    • Enterprise Products Partners (EPD +2.5%) completes a new fractionation unit at its plant in Mont Belvieu, Tex., boosting overall capacity there to 570K bbl/day.
    • The expanded capacity will allow the facility to process more of the natural gas liquids produced at shale plays in Texas, Colorado and elsewhere, EPD says.
    • It is the seventh natural gas liquids fractionation unit at the site; the eighth is in development and expected to be completed before the end of the year, boosting capacity at the plant to 655K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • KMP

    Energy MLPs pop on Fed no-taper news

    • Energy MLPs are spiking higher after the Fed decides not to taper, ensuring a longer period of lower-cost capital: KMP +2.9%, KMI +4.1%, ETP +2.1%, WPZ +1.2%, WMB +1.1%, EPD +1.9%, PAA +1.2%, EEP +1.3%, MWE +3.1%, MMP +2.4%, ACMP +2.9%, APL +1.8%, DPM +2.4%, SXL +1.5%, BPL +1.1%, PBA +2.3%, TLLP +1.7%.
    • Relevant ETFs: AMJ, AMLP, MLPG, MLPI, MLPN, MLPY, MLPL, MLPW, MLPS, YMLP, MLPA, EMLP, AMU, IMLP, MLPJ, ATMP, YMLI.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs lead the no taper party

    • Most stocks are partying in wake of the Fed not commencing its QE taper today, but one sector of note is the beaten down mortgage REIT (REM +2.8%) group.
    • Annaly (NLY +3.2%), American Capital (AGNC +3.5%), (MTGE +2.4%), Armour (ARR +3.4%), Two Harbors (TWO +3.4%), CYS Investments (CYS +3.7%), Anworth (ANH +2.8%), Western Asset (WMC +2.2%), Javelin (JMI +2%), AG Mortgage (MITT +2.1%), Arlington Asset (AI +1.6%).
    • Yesterday, KBW called out CYS Investments as one of the more aggressive plays for those believing rates might head lower.
    • ETFs of note: MORT, MORL.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 24 Comments
  • ARUN

    Aruba up following Piper coverage launch, Ruckus also higher

    • Piper's Troy Jensen has started coverage on Aruba (ARUN +2.8%) with an Overweight and $26 PT. The target is equal to 22x Piper's calendar 2015 op. income forecast (exc. cash).
    • Jensen observes Gartner expects the Wi-Fi hardware market to post a 15.6% CAGR through 2017. He also argues Aruba's "broad portfolio of both controller and controller-less [Wi-Fi] technology, coupled with leading software solutions, will translate to further share gains in 2014."
    • Jensen also thinks Aruba is "entering a period of easy comps and expanding margins."
    • IDC estimates Aruba's enterprise Wi-Fi sales rose 13.6% Y/Y in Q2, slightly below market growth of 14.8% and good for an 11% share.
    • Rival Ruckus (RKUS +3.5%), which was launched at Overweight by Piper in early July, is also trekking higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM

  • Stocks, bonds, gold gain after FOMC; dollar slides

    • S&P 500 (SPY +0.6%), DJIA (DIA +0.4%), and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ +0.6%) after the Fed surprises by not announcing any taper of its asset purchase program.
    • The 10-year Treasury note rises nearly a full point, the yield down to 2.78%. TLT +0.4%.
    • Precious metals soar, Gold (GLD +2.7%), Silver (SLV +2.9%), and the dollar (UUP -1%) heads south.
    • Money line from the FOMC statement: "The Committee decided to await more evidence that progress will be sustained before adjusting the pace of its purchases." Also noted is the "federal fiscal retrenchment."
    • Precious metals ETFs:Â GLD, IAU, SGOL, PHYS, AGOL, DGL, UBG, DGP, UGL, DZZ, GLL, DGZ, UGLD, DGLD, GLDI.
    • Treasury ETFs:Â TLH, TLT, IEF, DTYL, DLBL, ILTB, TENZ, ITE, TLO, EDV, VGIT, VGLT, TMF, TYD, LBND, UBT, UST, TMV, TYO, DSTJ, DSXJ, SBND, PST, TBT, DTYS, DLBS, TBF, TTT, TYNS, TYBS, TBX.
    • Dollar ETFs: UUPT, UDN. UDNT.
    • Index ETFs:Â IVV, SPY, VOO, RWL, SFLA, SSO, UPRO, SDS, SPXU, SH, EPS, RSP, BXUB, BXUC, BXDB,Â DIA, DDM, UDOW, DXD, SDOW, DOG,Â QQQ, QQEW, TQQQ, QID, SQQQ, PSQ, QLD, QQQE.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 12 Comments
  • PPO

    Benzinga: Nissan and LG supplier rumors take Polypore down

    • Polypore (PPO -4.5%) shares fell sharply after rumors surfaced that the company may have lost the battery component contract for the Nissan Leaf to Japan's Asahi Kasei, Benzinga reports.
    • Benzinga's coverage is based a source from Axiom Capital, which claims the Japanese competitor may have undercut Polypore's price for Li-Ion separator material (up from $1.60 to $2.60 per square meter after 2 layers of ceramic coating were added due to heat problems).
    • A second rumor said LG had qualified a Chinese supplier for its Li-Ion separator business. Axiom, which has a Sell rating on PPO, points out that the last time Polypore lost LG business, the stock tanked overÂ 20% in a day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAXN

    Taser rally won't quit

    • If you're a Taser (TASR +2.9%) shareholder, there's nothing you like better than news of new Axon deployments.
    • The stock has risen some 53% since August 12 on a steady stream of Axon-related PRs.
    • Today, the stock is extending its gains after the company announced multiple new deployments (too many to list) of the on-officer cameras and related subscription service EVIDENCE.com. (PR)
    • Incidentally, the shares were already up more than 7% this week going into today on the strength of a report out Monday which touted the deployment of additional TASR smart weapons. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment falls after doubling down on debt

    • Caesars Entertainment (CZR -11.8%) drops after the company announces it will need to raise $4.85 through the issuance of new bonds in order to refinance commercial mortgage-backed securities and repay a line at a credit facility.
    • Though the company has made some progress with its casino properties and is launching online poker this week, as the industry's most debt-laden name a good portion of the focus continues to be on its balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • IMMP

    Prima BioMed plunges on topline Phase 2 CVac analysis

    • Prima BioMed (PBMD -31.3%)Â plummets after releasing a topline analysis of the CVac epithelial ovarian cancer Phase 2 study.
    • PFS data prove "inconclusive" as "the estimate of median progression-free survival for all randomized patients resulted in no observed difference between the CVac and control groups."
    • When estimated separately for patients in first and second remission, median PFS favored the control arm for first remission and CVac for second remission (no statistical significance for either result).
    • It's too early to draw OS conclusions.
    • The company says the recent MAGE-A3 melanoma trial results might "indicate that PFS (and similar endpoints like disease-free survival) may not be useful markers of clinical benefit for cancer immunotherapeutics." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    Â 

    • Top 10 gainers: ATOS +31%. AQQ +24%. OXGN +18%. PRPH +16%. FU +14%. GERN +12%. AIRI +11%. SOHU +10%. RWC +9%. EGLE +9%.
    • Top 10 Losers: PBMD -32%. TWGP -27%. VRNM -18%. DRWI -17%. TGI -10%. CZR -11%. PRAN -7%. WPCS -8%. AXX -8%. GGS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • QTRH

    WiLAN climbs on HTC licensing agreement

    • WiLAN (WILN +10.4%) shares climb after the company inks a multi-year license with HTC for certain WiLAN patents patents relating to mobile handsets and tablets sold in the U.S.
    • A definitive agreement is expected by Oct. Terms are confidential.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • CSTI

    Costar Technologies spikes on bullish SA Pro article

    • Shares of Costar Technologies (OTCPK:CSTI +8.4%) spike after SA Pro's Money Treez makes the case (under embargo until 9:30 ET tomorrow) that the video monitoring/security company is delivering strong profitability and above-average return on capital while trading below book value.
    • Based on comparables, the analysis points to a potential upside of up to 290% with a favorable risk/reward ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • CB

    Guggenheim initiates coverage across insurance industry

    • ACE, AmTrust Financial (NASDAQ:AFSI), AllState (NYSE:ALL), AON, Meadowbrook (NYSE:MIG), Marsh & McLennan (NYSE:MMC) are all started at Buy, while Argo Group (AGII), AIG, Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD), Travelers (NYSE:TRV), Tower Group (NASDAQ:TWGP), and XL Group (NYSE:XL) are initiated at Hold.
    • Tower Group plummets 27% after further delaying the release of financial statements until the week of October 7, and FBR speculates the reserve charge could be as high as $125M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • VIPS

    Vipshop climbs following Deutsche upgrade, Chinese e-commerce plays follow

    • Shares of Vipshop (VIPS +10.5%) are climbing following Deutsche's upgrade of the company to Buy.
    • Chinese e-commerce plays are following suit, with LightInTheBox (NYSE:LITB) +4% as the recent IPO continues a rally after collapsing on Q1 results in Aug. and DangDang (NYSE:DANG) +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • HIMX

    New highs for Himax, Oppenheimer reports of broader LCOS interest

    • After meeting with Himax's (HIMX +5%) management, Oppenheimer declares management's tone has become even more bullish over the last two weeks, and reports the Google Glass design win has led to "significant" interest in Himax's LCOS microdisplay solutions from other firms.
    • Two weeks ago, Oppenheimer lifted its Himax PT to $12 from $9, and gushed over a better-than-expected outlook for the LCOS business. The note followed a similar one from Craig-Hallum.
    • Shares have made new highs, and are now up nearly 4x YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 8 Comments
  • REGN

    Regeneron extends rally

    • Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +3.7%) has been on a nice run of late thanks in part to speculation (fueled by some rather specific comments Chris Viehbacher made last week) that Sanofi (SNY -0.3%)Â may up its 16% stake to as much as 30% (the maximum allowed under the companies' partnership).
    • REGN is extending its gains today and is set to present Phase 3 VIVID/VISTA Eylea data later this month at the Retina Society's annual meeting. (PR)
    • There's also chatter that Goldman's Terence Flynn has upped his price target on the shares to $329 from $298.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • GME

    GameStop dips after news catches up to expectations

    • Shares of GameStop (GME -4%) fall back as some traders see this week's rally on enthusiasm about the gaming console product cycle as a bit overdone.
    • Though the launch of Grand Theft Auto V by Take-Two went well this week and new consoles still look promising, there's some sentiment that a lot of the news is already baked into GameStop's price.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • FI

    "Hidden gem" Frank's earns a Buy rating from UBS, shares +3.4%

    • Little-known oil equipment stock Frank's International (FI +3.4%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $33 price target at UBS, which cites four reasons why it's a "hidden gem":
    • Strong company operations - technical strengths, strong execution, above-average margins.
    • Attractive geographic exposure - 74% of revenues are driven by offshore markets and 45% from international activity.
    • Visible growth profile - offshore and international markets offers the highest growth opportunities in the market.
    • Financial strength - almost no debt, solid free cash flow yield (3%) and dividend yield (1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • RPRX

    Repros addresses ZA-302 questions, shares soar

    • In what may be an attempt to address some of the concerns raised about ZA-302 topline data, Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +6.7%) provides some additional confirmatory information regarding Androxal efficacy.
    • Notable: The phrase "statistically significant" is present in Wednesday's PR but was not included in Monday evening's release.
    • See also:Â Merrill raises price target on RPRX
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • RWC

    RELM Wireless wins $1.2M radio contract

    • RELM Wireless (RWC +5%) shares move up after the company receives a $1.2M order from a branch of the U.S. military for its KNG P25 portable radios and rapid-deployment repeaters. The company expects to fulfill the order in Q3.
    • CEO David Storey highlighted that the order is from a first-time customer as well as the first time that the company has been able to compete for these contract requirements.
    • Previous:Â RELM Wireless secures $1.7M in orders from U.S. agencies
    Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM

  • Treasury prices head lower ahead of FOMC announcement

    • Treasury prices turn south amid nervousness and loose chatter ahead of the FOMC this afternoon. Little-changed in early trade, the 10-year yield is all of a sudden up 5 basis points to 2.90%. TLT -0.6%. TBT +1.2%.
    • Markets are expecting the Fed's asset purchase program to be cut to $10B to $75B per month, but one rumor making the rounds says it will be $20B.
    • Treasury ETFs:Â TLH, TLT, IEF, DTYL, DLBL, ILTB, TENZ, ITE, TLO, EDV, VGIT, VGLT, TMF, TYD, LBND, UBT, UST, TMV, TYO, DSTJ, DSXJ, SBND, PST, TBT, DTYS, DLBS, TBF, TTT, TYNS, TYBS, TBX.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon gains on positive analyst commentary

    • Lululemon (LULU +2.5%) moves higher with some positive comments out from Canaccord Genuity.
    • The investment firm thinks shares of Lululemon can follow the same path higher that Under Armour did once it solved its own supply chain issues.
    • A well-received CEO hire could also provide a spark.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • WBMD

    WebMD slips on insider sales

    • Shares of WebMD (WBMD -3.2%) slip after 5 insiders disclosed selling a total of 256K shares yesterday, with chairman Martin Wygod dumping 186K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOHU

    Sohu rallies after detailing Tencent dividend payment

    • Sohu (SOHU +8.4%) has provided details about the $301M special dividend it's paying to holders of Series A preferred shares in its Sogou search unit, courtesy of the $448M investment Sogou is receiving from Tencent. Sohu sold off yesterday after Wedge Partners highlighted the dividend, and declared it to amount to insider highway robbery.
    • $161.2M of the dividend payment will go to Sohu's Sohu.com unit, and thus stay within the company. $96.7M will go to minority shareholder China Web Search.
    • Most notably, an investment vehicle owned by chairman/CEO Charles Zhang will only receive $43M, even though it owns 60% more Series A shares than Sohu.com. Zhang chose to receive dividend payments on only 1/6 of the Series A shares he owns through the vehicle.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences slides on possible Summer Street bear call

    • Coronado Biosciences (CNDO -4.5%)Â is trading notably lower on the session.
    • The move may be attributable to a bearish note out of Summer Street.
    • Just a guess: There may be skepticism around the company's lead product candidate TSO which is in Phase 2 testing for Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave prices stock/warrant offering, shares crash

    • DragonWave (DRWI -16.2%) is selling 11.9M shares at $2.10, good for gross proceeds of $25M. Moreover, for every 4 shares purchased through the offering, buyers will receive warrants to purchase 3 shares at $2.70 within the next 5 years.
    • DragonWave had previously stated the ratio of shares to warrants would be 2:1, rather than 4:3.
    • With DragonWave having closed yesterday at $2.47, investors aren't responding well to the news. Shares were at $2.74 before DragonWave first announced the offering last Thursday afternoon.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • NSM

    Nationstar raised to Buy at Jefferies

    • Another sell-sider gets on board with Nationstar Mortgage (NSM +2.5%), with Jefferies' Daniel Furtado upgrading to Buy and raising his price target to $64 from $40.
    • Upcoming catalysts include more bulk servicing transfers, the impact of higher rates (MSRs are more valuable when rates rise as prepayments slow), and the likely spinoff of SolutionStar.
    • Previous: Wells Fargo is shopping $41B UPB in MSRs.
    • More on SolutionStar.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver jumps on BB&T initiation

    • Shares of Quiksilver (ZQK +3.7%) jump after BB&T initiates the apparel maker at Buy with a PT of $11 (potential upside of 64.2% from yesterday's close).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • NOK

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • Nokia (NOK +3.3%) has been upgraded to Outperform by Credit Suisse after being upgraded by the firm to Neutral two weeks ago. Plenty of other firms have also upgraded (I, II) Nokia since the Microsoft deal was announced.
    • ServiceNow (NOW +3.5%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Morgan Stanley.
    • Maxwell (MXWL +8.6%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Piper.
    • Intuit (INTU -1.5%) has been cut to Underweight by Morgan Stanley.
    • AVG (AVG +3.1%) has been started at Buy by Nomura.
    • Cogent (CCOI +0.6%) has been started at Outperform by Pac Crest.
    • Cognizant (CTSH +2.7%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Barclays.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • WHR

    Report on housing starts helps to lift Whirlpool

    • Shares of Whirlpool (WHR +1.5%) trade higher following a decent gain in single-family housing starts in the U.S. during August.
    • The company's recipe for success is closely tied to a vibrant market for housing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • ATOS

    Atossa Genetics jumps after announcing ForeCYTE deal

    • Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) soars 29% premarket as the company inks a distribution deal with McKesson Medical-Surgical for the sale of ForeCYTE tests.
    • McKesson's sales force will sell and distribute the tests nationwide.
    • The agreement will "increase ATOS' penetration into all geographical markets while expanding relationships with physician offices," ATOS' VP of sales and marketing says. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • CL

    Colgate-Palmolive in focus

    • Shares of Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE:CL) move up 1% premarket after nabbing an upgrade from Barclays.
    • The ratings lift jumps out more than most with peers Procter & Gamble and Clorox both lowered by the investment firm on the same day.
    • The steady hand of management at Colgate-Palmolive in guiding the firm through economic turmoil and the board's generous buyback and dividend policies have set it apart from peers, according to analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • DS

    Too high of a dividend yield for New Residential

    • Newcastle Investment (NCT) spinoff New Residential (NYSE:NRZ) soars 6.9% premarket after declaring its first full quarterly dividend of $0.175 per share for a 10.95% yield (based on last night's close).
    • Nearly 11% is a whopper of a yield considering peers like Redwood (NYSE:RWT), HLSS, and Pennymac (NYSE:PMT) are in the 5-10% range.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 4 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ATOS +27%. AFOP +15%. ADBE +6%. NRZ +6%. ZIXI +6%. IDRA +5%.
    • Losers: PBMD -47%. DRWI -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan gains as it holds conference call

    • Some numbers in Kevin Kaiser's bearish research report are "flat out wrong," says Kinder Morgan management, holding a conference call to respond. Listen live here.
    • Not in on the call, Kaiser has his own list of questions.
    • KMI +3.5%, KMP +1%, EPB +1.7% premarket. KMR no action.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 49 Comments
  • CBMX

    CombiMatrix falls after S-1 filing

    • CombiMatrix (NASDAQ:CBMX) tumbles 10% premarket.
    • The company filed Wednesday to sell $10M in Class A and B units. (S-1)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel slides, Q1 outlook weak

    • Another quarter, another positive comps trifecta for Cracker Barrel (NASDAQ:CBRL) as comparable store traffic, restaurant sales, and retail sales grow 0.6%, 2.6%, and 1.1% respectively.
    • Revenue for FQ4 rose 3.9% Y/Y.
    • Average menu price rose 1.9%.
    • Gains in comparable restaurant traffic, average check total, and comparable restaurant sales were to some degree concentrated in May.
    • FY14 outlook: $5.60-5.80/share on revenue of $2.7-2.75B.
    • FQ1 outlook: $1.05-1.15/share. That's well below consensus of $1.32. Management cites "higher commodity costs, projected training and other expenses, and the cost of the bi-annual general managers meeting." (PR)
